item.title: ZSFG expert page transformation
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
There’s another update to the ongoing project to emphasize human-centered service provided by the library. The ZSFG Library page is no longer just a location page — it now highlights the full breadth of services users can expect. ZSFG Library has always been more challenging to represent and promote, because it serves ...

Read moreZSFG expert page transformation

item.title: Group Study Room User Research 2019
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
Summary: Survey results indicate users were generally satisfied with group study rooms in the library, but availability, connectivity, and upkeep discourage some from utilizing this service. Areas for opportunity are based on direct feedback and observation and could be used to guide the direction of the group study room service. ...

Read moreGroup Study Room User Research 2019

item.title: Exporting User Data from LibCal
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
Last December, the UX Team surveyed library staff members about Springshare products to gain a better understanding of use and satisfaction with the suite of products. From the survey results, we learned that staff are generally satisfied and mostly use LibCal in their daily work. Since then, we’ve followed up ...

Read moreExporting User Data from LibCal

item.title: Instructional Design + Human-Centered Design
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
by Anna VanderJagt and Lisa Leiva The UX Team recently collaborated with Lisa Leiva to apply a human-centered design approach to the Instructional Design (ID) service offered through the library. This new service seeks to support UCSF schools and programs in improving student engagement and learning outcomes. Developing a new ...

item.title: User Research: Springshare Satisfaction
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
Summary: Library staff are generally satisfied with Springshare products and mostly use LibCal in their daily work. Identified pain points include UI, exporting data, consultation scheduling, event parameters, and duplicating information. Software requirements are based on direct interaction with the products and feedback from staff. We will use these findings to ...

Read moreUser Research: Springshare Satisfaction

item.title: New Scholarly Communication Expert Pages
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
This month we launched the new and improved Scholarly Communication expert pages on the library website. As part of an ongoing project to emphasize human-centered service, we looked at usage patterns on the existing pages and collaborated with Anneliese to gather the most important tasks, messages, and pieces of information. The ...

item.title: Booking a Space for a Patron in LibCal
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
As most of you know, Springshare upgraded LibCal’s structure and underlying code over a year ago and stopped development for the Room Bookings module. On August 9 we migrated rooms and future bookings to the new Spaces module. While the new module includes improvements to hours and accessibility, some workflows ...

item.title: Faculty Support and Multimedia Expert Pages
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
In addition to the newly launched Data Science pages, this week we launched new Ask an Expert pages for Faculty Support and Multimedia Hardware and Software as part of the greater Ask an Expert redesign. The goal of this redesign is to simplify and streamline content and emphasize the human-centered ...

item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
A few months ago, the User Experience Team began to strategize about ways to highlight all the types of expertise and service that the Library offers.
